abstract: Major League Baseball will start streaming two live games a day to owners of its At Bat application for the Apple iPhone and iPod Touch.
snippet: Major League Baseball will start streaming two live games a day to owners of its At Bat application for the Apple iPhone and iPod Touch.
lead_paragraph: Update 10:39 a.m., June 17: The first game streamed by MLB.com will be Thursday’s 2:20 p.m. game between the Cubs and White Sox. An earlier version stated the first game would be on Wednesday.

headline.main: MLB.com Streams Live Baseball Games to the iPhone

abstract: Succumbing to consumer demand, Apple finally add basic features like voice commands, video capabilities, an improved camera and updated software.
snippet: Succumbing to consumer demand, Apple finally add basic features like voice commands, video capabilities, an improved camera and updated software.
lead_paragraph: Assessing the 2007 and 2008 iPhone models was an excruciating experience. You were torn in half  between your heart and your head.

headline.main: Apple Fills in Some Gaps With Latest iPhone

abstract: Gadget trade-in sites such as Gazelle and Flipswap are buying iPhones from owners eager to upgrade their device to the coming 3G S.
snippet: Gadget trade-in sites such as Gazelle and Flipswap are buying iPhones from owners eager to upgrade their device to the coming 3G S.
lead_paragraph: The third-generation iPhone, hitting the shelves of Apple and AT&T stores on Friday, will come equipped with a faster processor, a digital compass, a video recorder, a three-megapixel camera — and a hefty price tag for many current owners of the iPhone 3G.

headline.main: Used-Tech Dealers Do Booming Business in iPhone 3Gs

abstract: You can create a radio station, based on the selection of just a single song or artist, with Slacker on a BlackBerry Storm and Pandora on an Apple iPhone.
snippet: You can create a radio station, based on the selection of just a single song or artist, with Slacker on a BlackBerry Storm and Pandora on an Apple iPhone.
lead_paragraph: Last week, I was driving through town, listening to a song on the radio that I’d never heard. It was a slightly morose indie-rock track, so I hit fast-forward and got an upbeat Ryan Adams tune. I cranked the volume, then stopped to consider what I’d just done.

headline.main: Singing in the Car Along With Your Personal Radio Station
headline.print_headline: Singing in the Car Along With Your Personal Radio Station
